TopicTitle: Question for admins. Do you take me as "online troll"? LOL

Articles.Content:
I do not know maybe I'm a troll, but little overgrown because nearly 140 kilograms internet troll: D

But the way I am, but I do not want to be a troll, my professors have also blame me for the interruption during lectures, but on the other hand, once one of my favorite a Professor said that when it comes to the humanities, especially history, I have a mind like a razor, but I would give a chance finally to other students to demonstrate their knowledge: D but I just want to get an assessment of (5) or "A" according to the US-British standards: D

I'm good at debates

Edited July 22, 2014 by Pawelk198604
I think this post made them regard you as a online troll.

I've always been quite talkative both online and in real life: D

I am also quarrelsome and sensitive about being ignored by others.

I remember my older brother and cousin were talking about computers when I was 10 years.

wanting to join in the conversation because I was very interested in computers or something similar. My older brother, who was then 22 years old, said that the kid should be quiet when adults are talking, I replied that I do not care, I will not be be ignored. My brother said that he was just joking, but that people will never respect me if I will be arrogant and used bad words,

I do not know if this is caused by Asperger syndrome.

I'm little touchy:D

EDIT:

I wonder how to be a constructive member of the Internet community, and society in real life, and not be perceived as a troll or chatterbox: D

Edited July 22, 2014 by Pawelk198604

Being a troll requires doing deliberately malicious online acts. You do post a lot of threads, sometimes with tl;dr content, but I do not see you as a troll, and I doubt the admins do, either. They probably see you as a mild nuisance.

You should really try to lower your body weight, 140 kg is not healthy in any case.
You post alot, but your posts usually have subject matter. So i don't see you as a troll.

You should really try to lower your body weight, 140 kg is not healthy in any case.

Why is that? Did you talking about possible diabetic? My blood sugar is a-ok during last check-up:D

Although the dentist who yesterday removed my wisdom tooth, he asked before my procedure about body weight, when I told him he answered me. "Mr. Paul as a dentist-physician, albeit not medical-physician (Because dentistry is treated in Poland as another area of Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹medicine than regular medicine, dentists end other universities than ordinary doctors) he had to warn me that if i don't change my dietary habit, and not increase sport activities, i will kick the bucket before forties:D as he kindly said
You arent a troll. Trolls are beeing marked with a green or orange user name. So, you are good.

Why is that? Did you talking about possible diabetic? My blood sugar is a-ok during last check-up:D

Although the dentist who yesterday removed my wisdom tooth, he asked before my procedure about body weight, when I told him he answered me. "Mr. Paul as a dentist-physician, albeit not medical-physician (Because dentistry is treated in Poland as another area of Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹medicine than regular medicine, dentists end other universities than ordinary doctors) he had to warn me that if i don't change my dietary habit, and not increase sport activities, i will kick the bucket before forties:D as he kindly said

Why? Because your cardiovascular system is suffering, that's why. Your chances of kicking the bucket prematurely are indeed highly elevated.

I would say that as your English improves, less people will think you are a troll.

Also, IRL when someone asks a question, you don't always have to answer it. Let someone else answer most of the time, unless no one else knows the answer; no one will think any less of you. personally I find people that always answer questions a bit annoying. Just my advice, I'm not trying to criticize you.

We don't consider you a troll, and we handle threads and posts on a case-by-case basis. This thread, for example, isn't really about anything we want to get into on our forum, as discussing the personalities of our forum members tends to turn hurtful. We'll be closing this thread now.
